channel.title: I Need Help With My Router
channel.description:
well i was reading a thread named "Private Server Making Guide", and i came across: "Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into "advanced" (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the "gaming" button (is only left side for me...) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:
Name: 1 IP address: 2 TCP Ports to open: 43594 UDP Ports to open: Inbound Filter: Allow All Schedule: Always"
now, my big problem, is getting into the router like he says. do i need to go on my main computer to do it? and, do i type my IP adress in the URL bar? or, do i type it somwhere else? or do i type my gateway adress? im just alittle confused, if anyone could help me out, that would be great.
Guide: http://www.fagex.net/showthread.php?...d=1#post399791

item.title: I Need Help With My Router
item.dc:creator: @Khasck Khasck
item.description:
@Khasck wrote:

mmk, so hold reset 40 seconds on wireless router.
at end of 40 seconds, still holding the butten, un-plug the power? or all the chords? and on the wireless router? or on the reguler router?
then wait 10 seconds, plug it back in, and keep holding the reset butten for another 40 seconds.
then let go of the reset butten, and unplug the power? or all the chords? and on the wireless? or on the reguler router?
then wait 10 seconds, and plug it back in.
then hold the reset butten again, for another 40 seconds, and let it go?

Read full topic
item.source: I Need Help With My Router

item.title: I Need Help With My Router
item.dc:creator: @heybaby05 heybaby05
item.description:
@heybaby05 wrote:

ok on the wireless router hold reset button for 40 seconds dont let off
then while holdin reset have someone unplug it for 10 seconds still holdin reset and then after 10 seconds plug it back up and hold reset for 40 more seconds then after 40 seconds unplug it and the wait 10 seconds and the plug it back up and let off reset button and it should work ok .

Read full topic
item.source: I Need Help With My Router

item.title: I Need Help With My Router
item.dc:creator: @heybaby05 heybaby05
item.description:
@heybaby05 wrote:

umm ok wut u do type ur default gateway into ur url bar.
then something should come up and it should ask u for ur password.
ok the pass word should be admin or if u set ur own type it in ok.
next when u log on it u click on aplications and gammin or something like that then u click on port
forwardin and type in ur server name and the port then type in ur ip address in the box then click
proteocal and click on TCP and then click enable and click save settings and then go to ur sercurity and click disable on block Anonymous Internet Requests and u should have all ur ports open. then go put ur server on serverstatus page. and if this u can understand then idk i personly use linksys so idk.[br][size=1]Posted on: May 07, 2007, 05:43:59 PM[/size][hr]i hope that helps u

Read full topic

item.title: I Need Help With My Router
item.dc:creator: @Khasck Khasck
item.description:
@Khasck wrote:

well i was reading a thread named “Private Server Making Guide”, and i came across:
"Now we will need to make the rule for your router, by doing this you need to go into your router. You can do this by going into Internet Explorer (or whatever client you use for the Internet), and then type in the IP address of the router. Now log into the router and go into “advanced” (at top of screen on mine). Then on the sidebar to the left click the “gaming” button (is only left side for me…) Then you need to make a new rule and fill in the blanks with this information:

Name: 1
IP address: 2
TCP Ports to open: 43594
UDP Ports to open:
Inbound Filter: Allow All
Schedule: Always"

now, my big problem, is getting into the router like he says.
do i need to go on my main computer to do it?
and, do i type my IP adress in the URL bar?
or, do i type it somwhere else?
or do i type my gateway adress?
im just alittle confused, if anyone could help me out, that would be great.

Guide:
http://www.fagex.net/showthread.php?...d=1#post399791
